intro: Knautia kitaibelii, commonly known as the Balkan knautia, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features clusters of pink or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are hairy and lance-shaped, often with a reddish tinge. Knautia kitaibelii is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
